title: LModKeen 2 release 1 - for Windows and GNU/Linux users!
content:
LModKeen 2 released. This is a Windows and Linux port of Andy's ModKeen 2.0.1, by me. Includes complete FIN2BMP funcionality integrated in the Keen1-3 export procedure. For more details, see the README file included with the packages:

* Source code and pre-compiled binaries: [url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/src/lmodkeen2-rel1.tar.bz2]shadowm2006.sitesled.com/src/lmodkeen2-rel1.tar.bz2[/url]
* Windows executable: [url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/lmodkeen2-rel1-win32.zip]shadowm2006.sitesled.com/lmodkeen2-rel1-win32.zip[/url]

This version is now the first Windows port of ModKeen 2.0.1, and the second Linux port. Includes integrated (automatically used) FIN2BMP functionality. This is also the second Linux port of ModKeen.2.0.1.

Have fun!
All updates should be found near the last entry of this thread.
------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
Oh my word... You rock, sir! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
Thank you Shadow Master. You've helped me a lot now that I left Windows and I'm using Mandriva Linux 2007. I now can import/export data for my mods using LModKeen I, Fin2BMP for Linux, and make levels using Andy's GUI-based KeenWright (smoothly running under Wine [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] )

Consider this another step towards writing a ModKeen 2.x port for Windows. (Believe it or not, Windows and Linux share many aspects on the C program structure and such)------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content: If you're going to port it to a GUI environment, I recommend using wxWidgets - once you've ported something there, it'll compile for Windows, Linux, Mac, and anywhere else wxWidgets has been ported to.

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
I've been thinking about using that GUI library for a long time, the only thing I need is a complete manual on it (surely there's one in the wxGTK site). With that we could have the first GUI ModKeen version.

But that isn't gonna happen for now.

Updates:
LModKeen Mark II is coming. New features:
- Uses FIN2BMP code to export from PREVIEW?.CKx, FINALE.CKx, and import from xEXTyyyy.BMP files (were x is the episode number and yyyy is the image number) automatically on Keen 1-3.
- Fixes some ugly bugs in the ncurses initialization section.
- Experimental Keen Dreams support using MultiMania's code.

I have all that written by now. I just have to test it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
Well, I do have the source code for the version that supports DD\SK; as near as I can make out it's simply uses a different rgb plane thingy. DD and SK use the Keen engine and have the same finale.CK... format, again with shifted rgb values. It's quite surprising the number of Keen applications that support those two games.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
Well, if you give me the code, I can see what I can do for LModKeen III.
I'm gonna release LModKeen II beta today, so keep an eye in Keen: Modding.

EDIT: in fact, if you really want to keep informed of updates to this, visit Keen: Modding (www.keenmodding.org), "ModKeen" subforum.------------------

title: Re: ModKeen 2.0.1 and Fin2Bmp ported to GNU/Linux
content:
I release now LModKeen 2:
* Source code and pre-compiled binaries: [url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/src/lmodkeen2-rel1.tar.bz2]shadowm2006.sitesled.com/src/lmodkeen2-rel1.tar.bz2[/url]
* Windows executable: [url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/lmodkeen2-rel1-win32.zip]shadowm2006.sitesled.com/lmodkeen2-rel1-win32.zip[/url]

This version is now the first Windows port of ModKeen 2.0.1. Includes integrated (automatically used) FIN2BMP functionality. This is also the second Linux port of ModKeen.2.0.1.

Have fun!

EDIT: I should've mentioned again that it's a Windows port too, and a ready-to-use executable is provided with the package.

EDIT2: Did I mention you'll no longer need FIN2BMP if you use this tool? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ------------------

title: libModKeen
content: A library would be quite useful, actually. It'd have to be dynamically linked, though, so you can update it simply by installing a new version as per usual.

title: Re: libModKeen
content: what is TEDsetup??[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

title: Re: libModKeen
content:
Anyway, dynamic linking's not that hard to deal with once you've got the hang of it. I've written and compiled them on Windows, OS X and Linux now, so I'd be happy to help you if you needed any.

@Niborius: TEDSetup is the program you use to set up Keen 4-6 so you can edit their levels in TED, the level editor made by iD.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

content: ok, thanks for explaining[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: knowledge is power
content: I don't know much about C/C++. I just learned about creating dynamic libraries from reading tutorials and manuals. Like many things I know, I learnt it quickly and will probably forget it again in a while - then I'll relearn it the next time I need to create one. In fact, almost everything I know about computing is rediscovered on-the-fly when I suddenly need (or want) to know how to do it.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: disk glee won pouet
content:
[url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewtopic.php?t=964]EModKeen 3 alpha development thread[/url].

Yeah, the development was splitted in two branches, EModKeen 2.x (formerly known as LModKeen) and EModKeen 3. If you know of any game that uses the Keen engine, other than Shadow Knights, Bio Menace and Dangerous Dave 2, notify me and, if possible, send me its technical information.

EDIT: while rewriting the base source code based on LModKeen 2 release one, I noticed some potential bugs, so I'm pretty sure you've found bugs you've not dared to report, or you're not testing LModKeen 2. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img] ------------------------------
